title: Error: Failed to fetch the Solidity compiler
body: - [x] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue. --------------------------- ## Issue ## Steps to Reproduce 1. I created new directory Truffle: 2. `cd truffle` 3. `truffle init` 4. created a sampleContract.sol 5. `npm init -y` 6. for my contact i required npm package @openzeppelin/contracts : `npm install --save @openzeppelin/contracts` 7. `truffle compile` ## Expected Behavior it should compile normally but not compiled.!! ## Actual Results Not compiled ## Environment * Operating System: MacOS * Ethereum client: * Truffle version (`truffle version`): * node version (`node --version`): * npm version (`npm --version`):

Hey @n-dcool are you behind some special network (GFW or something else)?

Can you also try `node -e "fetch('https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/list.json').then(r => r.text()).then(console.log)"` and share with us the result? Thanks!

> Hey @N-dcool are you behind some special network (GFW or something else)? > > Can you also try `node -e "fetch('https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/list.json').then(r => r.text()).then(console.log)"` and share with us the result? Thanks! no I am not using any special network.

Do you get JavaScript when you click on the following URL? https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/solc-emscripten-wasm32-v0.8.17+commit.8df45f5f.js 

It seems like you should be able to access it.

> Do you get JavaScript when you click on the following URL? https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/solc-emscripten-wasm32-v0.8.17+commit.8df45f5f.js > > It seems like you should be able to access it. Yes I am getting javascript file :
Same issue here
I tested this on windows and it's working fine. Not working on Mac OS Ventura 13.2, Is this related to any network issue?

> I tested this on windows and it's working fine. Not working on Mac OS Ventura 13.2, Is this related to any network issue?
I think so its related to network issue in MacOS, it could be due to compatibility issues. :(
Any solution you can think of other than moving to windows :(
I have searched on StackOverflow and other community forums, but I haven't been able to find a proper solution to my problem.
It's working if am running "sudo truffle compile"
Thanks now its working fine and compiling!!

Ah, so maybe this is a problem with how you installed Truffle. Perhaps you installed Truffle using `sudo`. I would really recommend against doing this. If you do this, there can be permissions issues that can cause problems later.

Instead I would recommend re-installing Node and npm with a Node version manager like nvm, and this is actually what npm recommends. See [this article](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally#reinstall-npm-with-a-node-version-manager) for more information on this. Then you should run Truffle without `sudo`.
no I have not used `sudo` to install truffle instead used `npm install -g truffle`

> Ah, so maybe this is a problem with how you installed Truffle. Perhaps you installed Truffle using `sudo`. I would really recommend against doing this. If you do this, there can be permissions issues that can cause problems later.
> 
> Instead I would recommend re-installing Node and npm with a Node version manager like nvm, and this is actually what npm recommends. See [this article](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally#reinstall-npm-with-a-node-version-manager) for more information on this. Then you should run Truffle without `sudo`.

I suggest you to try `truffle compile` once in Mac machine, or there any wrong configuration in my system I will get to know!

I am on a mac (as well as a lot of people on my team) and I cannot reproduce your issue. I can run `truffle compile` without any problem. I suggest you try re-installing Node, npm, and Truffle (use the npm article I linked above) and see if you can compile after that. If you try it, let me know how it goes! I'll try and help you get it working on your machine.

I actually installed using nvm as docs suggest, other options all worked fine except the compile, where it's trying to download the compiler. When I run compile a second time without using sudo, it works.

> I am on a mac (as well as a lot of people on my team) and I cannot reproduce your issue. I can run `truffle compile` without any problem. I suggest you try re-installing Node, npm, and Truffle (use the npm article I linked above) and see if you can compile after that. If you try it, let me know how it goes! I'll try and help you get it working on your machine.

Also, what mac os are you running?

> > I am on a mac (as well as a lot of people on my team) and I cannot reproduce your issue. I can run `truffle compile` without any problem. I suggest you try re-installing Node, npm, and Truffle (use the npm article I linked above) and see if you can compile after that. If you try it, let me know how it goes! I'll try and help you get it working on your machine.
> 
> Also, what mac os are you running?

Ventura 13.1

> I am on a mac (as well as a lot of people on my team) and I cannot reproduce your issue. I can run `truffle compile` without any problem. I suggest you try re-installing Node, npm, and Truffle (use the npm article I linked above) and see if you can compile after that. If you try it, let me know how it goes! I'll try and help you get it working on your machine.

I re-install all packages again and at first I faced some issue while compiling 1st time but after that its working fine ðŸ˜„
@sixpep-vamshi did you end up re-installing with a Node version manager? Did you get this issue resolved?
I am having the same issue as OP, reinstalled using the provided link in thread and still having problems

@mjdacs how is your internet connection? This problem can also be caused by a bad connection. Could you try on a different one to see if you have the same issue? Also, are you able to get a valid response when trying to access the material at this url https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/solc-emscripten-wasm32-v0.8.17+commit.8df45f5f.js? You should see a bunch of JavaScript.

Connection is home internet and is good. I can probably try another connection this weekend. Yes, I am able to see the JavaScript in the link. I actually have this problem on both personal (mbair os v11.2.1) and work (mbpro os v13.2.1) machines.

So the fact that you can see that JavaScript means you can access the compiler but something must be going wrong somewhere else. Just to verify that you are using nvm, can you give me the output for when you enter `which truffle` in the terminal? It will give you the path to the truffle binary. You may, of course, remove anything that you might find to be "sensitive information" from the path it outputs. Thanks!
@eggplantzzz yes captain

Thanks! Hmm, I'll have to go look at the code a little bit more, figure out what else could be going on, and find another way to troubleshoot this.

Can you confirm that you are running `truffle compile` when you get this error? Also, can you paste the exact error that you receive?

Yes I get the same error when I run `truffle compile` or `truffle test` (which runs the compiler). 

`Compiling your contracts...`
`==========`
`Error: Failed to fetch the Solidity compiler from the following locations: https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-wasm32/,https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-asmjs/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-asmjs/,https://solc-bin.ethereum.org/bin/,https://ethereum.github.io/solc-bin/bin/. Are you connected to the internet?`


 `at VersionRange.<anonymous> (/Users/michael/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:189:1)
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at /Users/michael/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:8:1
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at exports.modules.780.__awaiter (/Users/michael/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:4:1)
    at VersionRange.getSolcFromCacheOrUrl (/Users/michael/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:180:1)
    at VersionRange.<anonymous> (/Users/michael/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:212:1)
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at fulfilled (/Users/michael/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:5:43)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
Truffle v5.7.7 (core: 5.7.7)
Node v18.14.1`

Thanks for confirming. Currently Truffle errors like this when something goes wrong while trying to fetch the compiler but our error messaging is a little bit imprecise unfortunately. Maybe I can go in a update the code so that the messaging reveals a little more precisely what is going on when it crashes. Give me a little bit of time but I'll try to continue helping troubleshoot.
Thank you, I will keep digging in the meantime on my end. Really appreciate the help.
Holy cow -- `sudo` fixed it. However I do not want to call `sudo` with truffle. What do i have to do there?
